label: RNAseqVariantCallingBatch-MOUSE-v1
description: RNA seq variant calling using GATK - MOUSE genome

inputs.label: Write haplotypes to BAM
inputs.description: Which haplotypes should be written to the BAM (ALL_POSSIBLE_HAPLOTYPES|CALLED_HAPLOTYPES)

inputs.label: Variant index type
inputs.description: Type of IndexCreator to use for VCF/BCF indices.

inputs.label: Variant index parameter
inputs.description: Parameter to pass to the VCF/BCF IndexCreator.

inputs.label: Validation Strictness
inputs.description: How strict should we be with validation.

inputs.label: Use Original Qualities
inputs.description: If set, use the original base quality scores from the OQ tag when present instead of the standard scores.

inputs.label: Use filtered reads
inputs.description: Use the contamination-filtered read maps for the purposes of annotating variants

inputs.label: Use alleles trigger
inputs.description: Use additional trigger on variants found in an external alleles file

inputs.label: Unsafe
inputs.description: If set, enables unsafe operations: nothing will be checked at runtime.  For expert users only who know what they are doing.  We do not support usage of this argument.

inputs.label: Threads per job (nct)
inputs.description: For tools which support multiprocessing, this value can be used to set the number of threads to be used. Set to 0 for auto-detect (use with caution,as auto-detect will find the optimal value in most cases).

inputs.label: Tag
inputs.description: Arbitrary tag string to identify this GATK run as part of a group of runs, for later analysis.

inputs.label: Standard emit confidence
inputs.description: The minimum phred-scaled confidence threshold at which variants should be emitted (and filtered with LowQual if less than the calling threshold). The minimum phred-scaled Qscore threshold to separate high confidence from low confidence calls. Only genotypes with confidence >= this threshold are emitted as called sites. A reasonable threshold is 30 for high-pass calling (this is the default).

inputs.label: Standard call confidence
inputs.description: The minimum phred-scaled confidence threshold at which variants should be called. The minimum phred-scaled Qscore threshold to separate high confidence from low confidence calls. Only genotypes with confidence >= this threshold are emitted as called sites. A reasonable threshold is 30 for high-pass calling (this is the default).

inputs.label: Siteslo only
inputs.description: Just output sites without genotypes (i.e. only the first 8 columns of the VCF).

inputs.label: Simplify bam
inputs.description: If provided, output BAM files will be simplified to include just key reads for downstream variation discovery analyses (removing duplicates, PF-, non-primary reads), as well stripping all extended tags from the kept reads except the read group identifier.

inputs.label: BAM list log entry
inputs.description: Emit a log entry (level INFO) containing the full list of sequence data files to be includedin the analysis (including files inside .bam.list files).

inputs.label: Sample rename mapping file
inputs.description: Rename sample IDs on-the-fly at runtime using the provided mapping file.

inputs.label: Sample Ploidy
inputs.description: Plody (number of chromosomes) per sample. For pooled data, set to (Number of samples in each pool * Sample Ploidy).

inputs.label: Sample name
inputs.description: Name of single sample to use from a multi-sample bam

inputs.label: Remove Program Records
inputs.description: Should we override the Walker's default and remove program records from the SAM header.

inputs.label: Reference Genome
inputs.description: Reference Genome in FASTA format.

inputs.label: Refactor ndn cigar string
inputs.description: Refactor cigar string with NDN elements to one element.

inputs.label: Input BAM/CRAM files
inputs.description: Input BAM or CRAM files

inputs.label: Read Group Black List
inputs.description: Filters out read groups matching : or a .txt file containing the filter strings one per line.

inputs.label: Read Filter
inputs.description: Specify filtration criteria to apply to each read individually.

inputs.label: Quantize BQ Scores
inputs.description: Quantize quality scores to a given number of levels (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Active probability threshold
inputs.description: Threshold for the probability of a profile state being active.

inputs.label: Preserve Qscores Less Than
inputs.description: Bases with quality scores less than this threshold won't be recalibrated (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Phone Home
inputs.description: What kind of GATK run report should we generate? STANDARD is the default, can be NO_ET so nothing is posted to the run repository. Please see http://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/discussion/1250/what-is-phone-home-and-how-does-it-affect-me#latest for details.

inputs.label: Runtime performance log
inputs.description: Write GATK runtime performance long. Specify the file name of this log.

inputs.label: Pedigree Validation Type
inputs.description: How strict should we be in validating the pedigree information?.

inputs.label: Pedigree String
inputs.description: Pedigree string for samples.

inputs.label: Pedigree
inputs.description: Pedigree files for samples.

inputs.label: PCR indel model
inputs.description: The PCR indel model to use (NONE|HOSTILE|AGGRESSIVE|CONSERVATIVE)

inputs.label: Raw activity profile output
inputs.description: Output the raw activity profile results in IGV format

inputs.label: Out mode
inputs.description: Specifies which type of calls we should output (EMIT_VARIANTS_ONLY|EMIT_ALL_CONFIDENT_SITES|EMIT_ALL_SITES)

inputs.label: Num bam file handles
inputs.description: Total number of BAM file handles to keep open simultaneously.

inputs.label: Non Deterministic Random Seed
inputs.description: Makes the GATK behave non deterministically, that is, the random numbers generated will be different in every run.

inputs.label: Dont use softclipeed bases
inputs.description: Do not analyze soft clipped bases in the reads

inputs.label: Don't trim active regions
inputs.description: If specified, we will not trim down the active region from the full region (active + extension) to just the active interval for genotyping

inputs.label: Never trim vcf format field
inputs.description: Always output all the records in VCF FORMAT fields, even if some are missing.

inputs.label: Monitor thread efficiency
inputs.description: Enable threading efficiency monitoring.

inputs.label: Phred mismapping rate
inputs.description: The global assumed mismapping rate for reads

inputs.label: Minimum reads per aligment
inputs.description: Minimum number of reads sharing the same alignment start for each genomic location in an active region

inputs.label: Minimum pruning threshold
inputs.description: Number of samples that must pass the minPruning threshold

inputs.label: Minimum dangling branch length
inputs.description: Minimum length of a dangling branch to attempt recovery

inputs.label: Minimum graph pruning
inputs.description: Minimum support to not prune paths in the graph

inputs.label: Minimum base quality scores
inputs.description: Minimum base quality required to consider a base for calling

inputs.label: Memory per job
inputs.description: Amount of RAM memory to be used per job. Defaults to 2048MB for Single threaded jobs,and all of the available memory on the instance for multi-threaded jobs. .

inputs.label: Memory overhead per job
inputs.description: Memory overhead per job. By default this parameter value is set to '0' (zero megabytes). This parameter value is added to the Memory per job parameter value. This results in the allocation of the sum total (Memory per job and Memory overhead per job) amount of memory per job. By default the memory per job parameter value is set to 2048 megabytes, unless specified otherwise.

inputs.label: Max Runtime Units
inputs.description: The TimeUnit for maxRuntime.

inputs.label: Max Runtime
inputs.description: If provided, that GATK will stop execution cleanly as soon after maxRuntime has been exceeded, truncating the run but not exiting with a failure.  By default the value is interpreted in minutes, but this can be changed by maxRuntimeUnits.

inputs.label: Maximum reads in active region
inputs.description: Maximum reads in an active region

inputs.label: Maximum number of haplotypes
inputs.description: Maximum number of haplotypes to consider for your population

inputs.label: Max Alternate Alleles
inputs.description: Maximum number of alternate alleles to genotype.

inputs.label: Maximum size of active region
inputs.description: The active region maximum size; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default

inputs.label: K-mer size
inputs.description: Kmer size to use in the read threading assembler

inputs.label: Keep Program Records
inputs.description: Should we override the Walker's default and keep program records from the SAM header.

inputs.label: Intervals
inputs.description: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate.

inputs.label: Intervals
inputs.description: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate. Can be an specified in an .intervals file or a rod file.

inputs.label: Interval Set Rule
inputs.description: Indicates the set merging approach the interval parser should use to combine the various -L or -XL inputs.

inputs.label: Interval Padding
inputs.description: Indicates how many basepairs of padding to include around each of the intervals specified with the -L/--intervals argument.

inputs.label: Interval Merging
inputs.description: Indicates the interval merging rule we should use for abutting intervals.

inputs.label: Input prior
inputs.description: Input prior for calls.

inputs.label: Indel size
inputs.description: The size of an indel to check for in the reference model

inputs.label: Indel Heterozygosity
inputs.description: Heterozygosity for indel calling.

inputs.label: Heterozygosity
inputs.description: Heterozygosity value used to compute prior likelihoods for any locus.

inputs.label: Graph file output
inputs.description: Write debug assembly graph information to this file

inputs.label: GQ threshold
inputs.description: GQ thresholds for reference confidence bands

inputs.label: Global q score prior
inputs.description: Global Qscore Bayesian prior to use for BQSR.

inputs.label: Genotyping mode
inputs.description: Specifies how to determine the alternate alleles to use for genotyping (DISCOVERY|GENOTYPE_GIVEN_ALLELES)

inputs.label: Generate MD5
inputs.description: Enable on-the-fly creation of md5s for output BAM files.

inputs.label: Gatk key
inputs.description: GATK Key file. Required if running with -et NO_ET. Please see http://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/discussion/1250/what-is-phone-home-and-how-does-it-affect-me#latest for details.

inputs.label: Gap continuation penalty
inputs.description: Flat gap continuation penalty for use in the Pair HMM

inputs.label: Force active bases
inputs.description: If provided, all bases will be tagged as active

inputs.label: Fix Misencoded Quals
inputs.description: Fix mis-encoded base quality scores.

inputs.label: Exclude Intervals
inputs.description: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing. Can be an .intervals file or a rod file.

inputs.label: Exclude annotation
inputs.description: One or more specific annotations to exclude

inputs.label: Emit reference confidence
inputs.description: Mode for emitting reference confidence scores (NONE|BP_RESOLUTION|GVCF)

inputs.label: Emit Original Quals
inputs.description: If true, enables printing of the OQ tag with the original base qualities (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Downsampling Type
inputs.description: Type of reads downsampling to employ at a given locus. Reads will be selected randomly to be removed from the pile based on the method described here.

inputs.label: Downsample to Fraction
inputs.description: Fraction [0.0-1.0] of reads to downsample to.

inputs.label: Downsample to Coverage
inputs.description: Coverage to downsample to at any given locus; note that downsampled reads are randomly selected from all possible reads at a locus. For non-locus-based traversals (eg., ReadWalkers), this sets the maximum number of reads at each alignment start position.

inputs.label: Don't increase K-mer size
inputs.description: Disable iterating over kmer sizes when graph cycles are detected

inputs.label: Read filter(s) to disable
inputs.description: Read filters to disable. Specify which filter(s) to disable.

inputs.label: Disable phasing
inputs.description: Disable physical phasing

inputs.label: Disable optimizations
inputs.description: Don't skip calculations in ActiveRegions with no variants

inputs.label: Disable Indel Quals
inputs.description: If 'true', disables printing of base insertion and base deletion tags (with -BQSR). Turns off printing of the base insertion and base deletion tags when using the -BQSR argument and only the base substitution qualities will be produced.

inputs.label: Disable bam indexing
inputs.description: Turn off on-the-fly creation of indices for output BAM files.

inputs.label: Disable index generation and locking
inputs.description: Disable both auto-generation of index files and index file locking.

inputs.label: Default Base Qualities
inputs.description: If reads are missing some or all base quality scores, this value will be used for all base quality scores.

inputs.label: Debug
inputs.description: Print out very verbose debug information about each triggering active region

inputs.label: DB SNP file
inputs.description: DB SNP file

inputs.label: CPU per job
inputs.description: Number of CPUs per job.

inputs.label: Contamination fraction
inputs.description: Fraction of contamination in sequencing data (for all samples) to aggressively remove

inputs.label: Contamination file
inputs.description: Tab-separated File containing fraction of contamination in sequencing data (per sample) to aggressively remove. Format should be SampleID><TAB><Contamination>" (Contamination is double) per line; No header.

inputs.label: Consensus mode
inputs.description: 1000G consensus mode

inputs.label: Comparison VCF file
inputs.description: Comparison VCF file

inputs.label: BQSR
inputs.description: Any recalibration table without a specific role.

inputs.label: BAQ Gap Open Penalty
inputs.description: BAQ gap open penalty (Phred Scaled). Default value is 40. 30 is perhaps better for whole genome call sets.

inputs.label: BAQ Calculation Type
inputs.description: Type of BAQ calculation to apply in the engine.

inputs.label: Band pass sigma
inputs.description: The sigma of the band pass filter Gaussian kernel; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default

inputs.label: Write haplotypes to specified BAM
inputs.description: File to which assembled haplotypes should be written

inputs.label: Bam compression
inputs.description: Compression level to use for writing BAM files (0 - 9, higher is more compressed).

inputs.label: Apply groups of annotaitons
inputs.description: One or more classes/groups of annotations to apply to variant calls

inputs.label: Annotation
inputs.description: One or more specific annotations to apply to variant calls.

inputs.label: Annotate Nda
inputs.description: If provided, we will annotate records with the number of alternate alleles that were discovered (but not necessarily genotyped) at a given site.

inputs.label: Annotate all sites with PLs
inputs.description: Annotate all sites with PLs

inputs.label: Allow Potentially Misencoded Quals
inputs.description: Do not fail when encountered base qualities that are too high and seemingly indicate a problem with the base quality encoding of the BAM file.

inputs.label: Allow non-unique K-mers in graph
inputs.description: Allow graphs that have non-unique kmers in the reference

inputs.label: Alleles
inputs.description: The set of alleles at which to genotype when --genotyping_mode is GENOTYPE_GIVEN_ALLELES

inputs.label: Include non-variants
inputs.description: Include loci found to be non-variant after genotyping.

inputs.label: Active region list file
inputs.description: Use this interval list file as the active regions to process

inputs.label: Output IGV formatted file
inputs.description: Output the active region to this IGV formatted file

inputs.label: Active region extension
inputs.description: The active region extension; if not provided defaults to Walker annotated default

run.label: GATK HaplotypeCaller
run.description:
###**Overview**  

The HaplotypeCaller is capable of calling SNPs and indels simultaneously via local de-novo assembly of haplotypes in an active region. In other words, whenever the program encounters a region showing signs of variation, it discards the existing mapping information and completely reassembles the reads in that region. This allows the HaplotypeCaller to be more accurate when calling regions that are traditionally difficult to call, for example when they contain different types of variants close to each other. It also makes the HaplotypeCaller much better at calling indels than position-based callers like UnifiedGenotyper.  

In the so-called GVCF mode used for scalable variant calling in DNA sequence data, HaplotypeCaller runs per-sample to generate an intermediate genomic gVCF (gVCF), which can then be used for joint genotyping of multiple samples in a very efficient way, which enables rapid incremental processing of samples as they roll off the sequencer, as well as scaling to very large cohort sizes (e.g. the 92K exomes of ExAC).  

In addition, HaplotypeCaller is able to handle non-diploid organisms as well as pooled experiment data. Note however that the algorithms used to calculate variant likelihoods is not well suited to extreme allele frequencies (relative to ploidy) so its use is not recommended for somatic (cancer) variant discovery. For that purpose, use MuTect2 instead.  

Finally, HaplotypeCaller is also able to correctly handle the splice junctions that make RNAseq a challenge for most variant callers.  

###**Input**  
Input bam file(s) from which to make calls

###**Output**  
Either a VCF or gVCF file with raw, unfiltered SNP and indel calls. Regular VCFs must be filtered either by variant recalibration (best) or hard-filtering before use in downstream analyses. If using the reference-confidence model workflow for cohort analysis, the output is a GVCF file that must first be run through GenotypeGVCFs and then filtering before further analysis.

###**Usage examples**  
These are example commands that show how to run HaplotypeCaller for typical use cases. 
Square brackets ("[ ]") indicate optional arguments. Note that parameter values shown here may not be the latest recommended; see the Best Practices documentation for detailed recommendations.

Single-sample GVCF calling on DNAseq (for ***-ERC GVCF*** cohort analysis workflow)  

    java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \  
         -R reference.fasta \  
         -T HaplotypeCaller \  
         -I sample1.bam \  
         --emitRefConfidence GVCF \  
         [--dbsnp dbSNP.vcf] \  
         [-L targets.interval_list] \  
         -o output.raw.snps.indels.g.vcf  

Variant-only calling on DNAseq  

    java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \  
         -R reference.fasta \  
         -T HaplotypeCaller \  
         -I sample1.bam [-I sample2.bam ...] \  
          [--dbsnp dbSNP.vcf] \  
          [-stand_call_conf 30] \  
          [-stand_emit_conf 10] \  
          [-L targets.interval_list] \  
          -o output.raw.snps.indels.vcf  

Variant-only calling on RNAseq  

     java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \  
          -R reference.fasta \  
          -T HaplotypeCaller \  
          -I sample1.bam \  
          [--dbsnp dbSNP.vcf] \  
          -stand_call_conf 20 \  
          -stand_emit_conf 20 \  
          -o output.raw.snps.indels.vcf  

###**IMPORTANT NOTICE**  

Tools in GATK that require a fasta reference file also look for the reference file's corresponding *.fai* (fasta index) and *.dict* (fasta dictionary) files. The fasta index file allows random access to reference bases and the dictionary file is a dictionary of the contig names and sizes contained within the fasta reference. These two secondary files are essential for GATK to work properly. To append these two files to your fasta reference please use the '***SBG FASTA Indices***' tool within your GATK based workflow before using any of the GATK tools.

outputs.label: VCF
outputs.description: A raw, unfiltered, highly specific callset in VCF format.

inputs.label: FASTA file
inputs.description: FASTA file to be indexed

run.label: SBG FASTA Indices
run.description: Tool allows creating FASTA dictionary and index simultaneously which is necessary for running GATK tools. This version of tool for indexing uses SAMtools faidx command (toolkit version0.1.19), while for the FASTA dictionary is used Picard CreateFastaDictionary (toolkit version 1.140)

run.description:
###**Overview**  
This tool is designed for hard-filtering variant calls based on certain criteria. Records are hard-filtered by changing the value in the FILTER field to something other than PASS. Filtered records will be preserved in the output unless their removal is requested in the command line.  

###**Input**  
A variant set to filter.  

###**Output**  
A filtered VCF.  

###**Usage example**  

    java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \  
         -T VariantFiltration \  
         -R reference.fasta \  
         -o output.vcf \  
         --variant input.vcf \  
         --filterExpression "AB < 0.2 || MQ0 > 50" \  
         --filterName "Nov09filters" \  
         --mask mask.vcf \  
         --maskName InDel  

###**IMPORTANT NOTICE**  

Tools in GATK that require a fasta reference file also look for the reference file's corresponding *.fai* (fasta index) and *.dict* (fasta dictionary) files. The fasta index file allows random access to reference bases and the dictionary file is a dictionary of the contig names and sizes contained within the fasta reference. These two secondary files are essential for GATK to work properly. To append these two files to your fasta reference please use the '***SBG FASTA Indices***' tool within your GATK based workflow before using any of the GATK tools.

outputs.label: Filtered VCF
outputs.description: File to which variants should be written.

run.label: GATK VariantFiltration

inputs.label: Validation stringency
inputs.description: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program. Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {STRICT, LENIENT, SILENT}.

inputs.label: Sort order
inputs.description: Sort order of the output file. Possible values: {unsorted, queryname, coordinate}.

inputs.label: Quiet
inputs.description: This parameter indicates whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

inputs.label: Output format
inputs.description: Since Picard tools can output both SAM and BAM files, user can choose the format of the output file.

inputs.label: Memory per job
inputs.description: Amount of RAM memory to be used per job. Defaults to 2048 MB for single threaded jobs.

inputs.label: Max records in RAM
inputs.description: When writing SAM files that need to be sorted, this parameter will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort a SAM file, and increases the amount of RAM needed. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

inputs.label: Create index
inputs.description: This parameter indicates whether to create a BAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM file. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

inputs.label: Compression level
inputs.description: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and GELI). This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value.

Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded. Default value: STRICT. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {STRICT, LENIENT, SILENT}.

inputs.label: Input
inputs.description: Input file (BAM or SAM) from which reads will be extracted.  Required.

inputs.label: Create index

inputs.label: Compression level

inputs.label: Allow incomplete dict concordance
inputs.description: If true, then allows only a partial overlap of the BAM contigs with the new reference sequence contigs.  By default, this tool requires a corresponding contig in the new reference for each read contig  Default value: false. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

inputs.label: Allow contig length discordance
inputs.description: If true is selected, this attribute permits mapping from a read contig to a new reference contig with the same name but a different length. To be modified only by experienced users. Default value: false. This option can be set to 'null' to clear the default value. Possible values: {true, false}.

run.label: Picard ReorderSam
run.sbg:revisionNotes: Input categories added. Also some indexing options changed.
run.description:
Picard ReorderSam reorders reads in a SAM or BAM file to match the contig ordering in a provided reference file, as determined by exact-name matching of contigs.  Reads mapped to contigs absent in the new reference are dropped. This runs substantially faster if the input is an indexed BAM file.

Note: the Picard ReorderSam is not to be confused with Picard SortSam, which sorts a SAM or BAM file with a valid sequence dictionary.

outputs.label: Reordered bam
outputs.description: Output file (bam or sam) to write extracted reads to.

run.label: SnpEff
run.sbg:license: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0 only

outputs.label: Summary file
outputs.description: SnpEff summary file in HTML or CSV file format.

run.description:
**SnpEff** is a variant annotation and effect prediction​ tool, which annotates and predicts the effects of variants on genes, such as amino acid changes [1].

*A list of **all inputs and parameters** with corresponding descriptions can be found at the end of the page.*

### Common Use Cases

Typical usage assumes predicted variants (SNPs, insertions, deletions, and MNPs) as input, usually in variant call format (VCF). **SnpEff** analyzes and annotates input variants and calculates the effects they produce on known genes [1]. The output file can be in several file formats, most common being VCF.

**SnpEff** requires an annotation database to run. Official SnpEff annotation databases can be downloaded from [here](https://sourceforge.net/projects/snpeff/files/databases/v4_3/); however, human databases are also hosted on Seven Bridges, in Public Reference Files section (files snpEff_v4_3_GRCh38.86.zip and	snpEff_v4_3_GRCh37.75.zip) and can be [imported](https://docs.sevenbridges.com/docs/copy-files-using-the-visual-interface).

### Changes Introduced by Seven Bridges

* Input VCF file (**Input variants file**) is required (as opposed to default input being STDIN).
* Parameter **Java memory requirement [Gb]** which controls the amount of RAM available to **SnpEff** was included in the wrapper.
* The following parameters have been excluded from the wrapper:  
    * `-download`  - The tool is expected to use data from the provided database archive.
    * `-fileList` - Processing multiple files can be achieved by using batch tasks or scatter mode in workflows.
    * `-dataDir <path>`  - In the wrapper, data directory is always the same and corresponds to the location of the prepared **SnpEff** database.
    * `-download`  - Supplying a database archive as an input is required. Downloading missing data for a genome from command line is not supported.
    * `-help`, `-quiet`, `-verbose`, `-debug` and `-version` - These options are not usually included in Seven Bridges wrappers.

### Common Issues and Important Notes

* Required inputs are **Input variants file** (a VCF or VCF.GZ file to be annotated), **SnpEff database file** (SnpEff database ZIP archive matching the major version of SnpEff used [2], which is 4.3 for this wrapper; e.g. snpEff_v4_3_GRCh38.86.zip or snpEff_v4_3_GRCh37.75.zip from Public Reference Files section), and **Assembly (genome version)**, which is a string representing genome version/assembly (e.g., GRCh38.86, GRCh37.75, hg19), matching the SnpEff database used (GRCh38.86 and GRCh37.75 should be used for the files in the Public Reference Files section).
* As **SnpEff** is a java tool, it may be occasionally necessary to increase the amount of allocated RAM (default value: 8192 MB), using the **Java memory requirement [Gb]** parameter.
* A number of **SnpEff** command line options are designed in mutually exclusive pairs (for example `-noStats` and `-stats` or `-lof` and `-noLof`) with some redundancy. These options should not be used together, to avoid task failure.
* Multithreading parameter **Use multiple threads (implies '-noStats')** (`-t`) will disable statistics. 
* Disabling statistics using **Do not create stats (summary) file** (`-noStats`) will in general speed-up execution.

### Performance Benchmarking

Annotating NA12878 genome (GRCh38, ~220 Mb as VCF.GZ) with default annotation parameters, 1 CPU, and 8192 MB RAM took 25 minutes with a cost of $0.17 using on-demand default instance.
By default, **SnpEff** is allocated 8192 MB of memory. Allocating less memory is not recommended when working with whole genome VCF files.

*Cost can be significantly reduced by **spot instance** usage. Visit [knowledge center](https://docs.sevenbridges.com/docs/about-spot-instances) for more details.*            

### References

[1] [SnpEff documentation](http://snpeff.sourceforge.net/SnpEff_manual.html)

[2] [Official SnpEff 4.3 databases download location](https://sourceforge.net/projects/snpeff/files/databases/v4_3/)

inputs.label: Variant index type
inputs.description: Type of IndexCreator to use for VCF/BCF indices.

inputs.label: Variant index parameter
inputs.description: Parameter to pass to the VCF/BCF IndexCreator.

inputs.label: Validation Strictness
inputs.description: How strict should we be with validation.

inputs.label: Use Original Qualities
inputs.description: If set, use the original base quality scores from the OQ tag when present instead of the standard scores.

inputs.label: Unsafe
inputs.description: If set, enables unsafe operations: nothing will be checked at runtime.  For expert users only who know what they are doing.  We do not support usage of this argument.

inputs.label: Threads per job
inputs.description: For tools which support multiprocessing, this value can be used to set the number of threads to be used. Set to 0 for auto-detect (use with caution,as auto-detect will find the optimal value in most cases).

inputs.label: Tag
inputs.description: Arbitrary tag string to identify this GATK run as part of a group of runs, for later analysis.

inputs.label: Siteslo only
inputs.description: Just output sites without genotypes (i.e. only the first 8 columns of the VCF).

inputs.label: Simplify bam
inputs.description: If provided, output BAM files will be simplified to include just key reads for downstream variation discovery analyses (removing duplicates, PF-, non-primary reads), as well stripping all extended tags from the kept reads except the read group identifier.

inputs.label: BAM list log entry
inputs.description: Emit a log entry (level INFO) containing the full list of sequence data files to be includedin the analysis (including files inside .bam.list files).

inputs.label: Sample rename mapping file
inputs.description: Rename sample IDs on-the-fly at runtime using the provided mapping file.

inputs.label: Remove Program Records
inputs.description: Should we override the Walker's default and remove program records from the SAM header.

inputs.label: Reference Genome
inputs.description: Reference Genome in FASTA format.

inputs.label: Refactor ndn cigar string
inputs.description: Refactor cigar string with NDN elements to one element.

inputs.label: Read sequences
inputs.description: Read sequences in BAM format.

inputs.label: Read Group Black List
inputs.description: Filters out read groups matching : or a .txt file containing the filter strings one per line.

inputs.label: Read Filter
inputs.description: Specify filtration criteria to apply to each read individually.

inputs.label: Quantize BQ Scores
inputs.description: Quantize quality scores to a given number of levels (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Preserve Qscores Less Than
inputs.description: Bases with quality scores less than this threshold won't be recalibrated (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Phone Home
inputs.description: What kind of GATK run report should we generate? STANDARD is the default, can be NO_ET so nothing is posted to the run repository. Please see http://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/discussion/1250/what-is-phone-home-and-how-does-it-affect-me#latest for details.

inputs.label: Runtime performance log
inputs.description: Write GATK runtime performance long. Specify the file name of this log.

inputs.label: Pedigree Validation Type
inputs.description: How strict should we be in validating the pedigree information?.

inputs.label: Pedigree String
inputs.description: Pedigree string for samples.

inputs.label: Pedigree
inputs.description: Pedigree files for samples.

inputs.label: Num bam file handles
inputs.description: Total number of BAM file handles to keep open simultaneously.

inputs.label: Non Deterministic Random Seed
inputs.description: Makes the GATK behave non deterministically, that is, the random numbers generated will be different in every run.

inputs.label: Never trim vcf format field
inputs.description: Always output all the records in VCF FORMAT fields, even if some are missing.

inputs.label: Monitor thread efficiency
inputs.description: Enable threading efficiency monitoring.

inputs.label: Memory per job
inputs.description: Amount of RAM memory to be used per job. Defaults to 2048MB for Single threaded jobs,and all of the available memory on the instance for multi-threaded jobs. .

inputs.label: Memory overhead per job
inputs.description: Memory overhead per job. By default this parameter value is set to '0' (zero megabytes). This parameter value is added to the Memory per job parameter value. This results in the allocation of the sum total (Memory per job and Memory overhead per job) amount of memory per job. By default the memory per job parameter value is set to 2048 megabytes, unless specified otherwise.

inputs.label: Max Runtime Units
inputs.description: The TimeUnit for maxRuntime.

inputs.label: Max Runtime
inputs.description: If provided, that GATK will stop execution cleanly as soon after maxRuntime has been exceeded, truncating the run but not exiting with a failure.  By default the value is interpreted in minutes, but this can be changed by maxRuntimeUnits.

inputs.label: Max reads in memory
inputs.description: Max reads allowed to be kept in memory at a time by the bam writer. If there are more than this many mismatches within the overhang regions, the whole overhang will get hard-clipped out. It is still possible in some cases that the overhang could get clipped if the number of mismatches do not exceed this value, e.g. if most of the overhang mismatches.

inputs.label: Max mismatches in overhang
inputs.description: Number of mismatches allowed in the overhang. If there are more than this many mismatches within the overhang regions, the whole overhang will get hard-clipped out. It is still possible in some cases that the overhang could get clipped if the number of mismatches do not exceed this value, e.g. if most of the overhang mismatches.

inputs.label: Max bases in overhang
inputs.description: Number of bases allowed in the overhang. If there are more than this many bases in the overhang, we won't try to hard-clip them out.

inputs.label: Keep Program Records
inputs.description: Should we override the Walker's default and keep program records from the SAM header.

inputs.label: Intervals
inputs.description: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate.

inputs.label: Intervals
inputs.description: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate. Can be an specified in an .intervals file or a rod file.

inputs.label: Interval Set Rule
inputs.description: Indicates the set merging approach the interval parser should use to combine the various -L or -XL inputs.

inputs.label: Interval Padding
inputs.description: Indicates how many basepairs of padding to include around each of the intervals specified with the -L/--intervals argument.

inputs.label: Interval Merging
inputs.description: Indicates the interval merging rule we should use for abutting intervals.

inputs.label: Global q score prior
inputs.description: Global Qscore Bayesian prior to use for BQSR.

inputs.label: Generate MD5
inputs.description: Enable on-the-fly creation of md5s for output BAM files.

inputs.label: Gatk key
inputs.description: GATK Key file. Required if running with -et NO_ET. Please see http://gatkforums.broadinstitute.org/discussion/1250/what-is-phone-home-and-how-does-it-affect-me#latest for details.

inputs.label: Fix Misencoded Quals
inputs.description: Fix mis-encoded base quality scores.

inputs.label: Emit Original Quals
inputs.description: If true, enables printing of the OQ tag with the original base qualities (with -BQSR).

inputs.label: Downsampling Type
inputs.description: Type of reads downsampling to employ at a given locus. Reads will be selected randomly to be removed from the pile based on the method described here.

inputs.label: Downsample to Fraction
inputs.description: Fraction [0.0-1.0] of reads to downsample to.

inputs.label: Downsample to Coverage
inputs.description: Coverage to downsample to at any given locus; note that downsampled reads are randomly selected from all possible reads at a locus. For non-locus-based traversals (eg., ReadWalkers), this sets the maximum number of reads at each alignment start position.

inputs.label: Do not fix overhangs
inputs.description: Do not have the walker hard-clip overhanging sections of the reads.

inputs.label: Read filter(s) to disable
inputs.description: Read filters to disable. Specify which filter(s) to disable.

inputs.label: Disable Indel Quals
inputs.description: If 'true', disables printing of base insertion and base deletion tags (with -BQSR). Turns off printing of the base insertion and base deletion tags when using the -BQSR argument and only the base substitution qualities will be produced.

inputs.label: Disable bam indexing
inputs.description: Turn off on-the-fly creation of indices for output BAM files.

inputs.label: Disable index generation and locking
inputs.description: Disable both auto-generation of index files and index file locking.

inputs.label: Default Base Qualities
inputs.description: If reads are missing some or all base quality scores, this value will be used for all base quality scores.

inputs.label: CPU per job
inputs.description: Number of CPUs per job.

inputs.label: BQSR
inputs.description: Input covariates table file for on-the-fly base quality score recalibration.

inputs.label: BAQ Gap Open Penalty
inputs.description: BAQ gap open penalty (Phred Scaled). Default value is 40. 30 is perhaps better for whole genome call sets.

inputs.label: BAQ Calculation Type
inputs.description: Type of BAQ calculation to apply in the engine.

inputs.label: Bam compression
inputs.description: Compression level to use for writing BAM files (0 - 9, higher is more compressed).

inputs.label: Allow Potentially Misencoded Quals
inputs.description: Do not fail when encountered base qualities that are too high and seemingly indicate a problem with the base quality encoding of the BAM file.

run.label: GATK SplitNCigarReads
run.description:
###**Overview**  

This tool identifies all N cigar elements in sequence reads, and creates k+1 new reads (where k is the number of N cigar elements) that correspond to the segments of the original read beside/between the splicing events represented by the Ns in the original CIGAR. The first read includes the bases that are to the left of the first N element, while the part of the read that is to the right of the N (including the Ns) is hard clipped, and so on for the rest of the new reads.  

###**Input**  
One or more bam files  

###**Output**  
A single processed bam file.  

###**Usage examples**  

    java -jar GenomeAnalysisTK.jar \  
         -T SplitNCigarReads \  
         -R reference.fasta \  
         -I input.bam \  
         -o output.bam \  
         -U ALLOW_N_CIGARS  

 When this tool is used as part of the RNAseq best practices, the command should include mapping quality
 reassignment.  

###**IMPORTANT NOTICE**  

Tools in GATK that require a fasta reference file also look for the reference file's corresponding *.fai* (fasta index) and *.dict* (fasta dictionary) files. The fasta index file allows random access to reference bases and the dictionary file is a dictionary of the contig names and sizes contained within the fasta reference. These two secondary files are essential for GATK to work properly. To append these two files to your fasta reference please use the '***SBG FASTA Indices***' tool within your GATK based workflow before using any of the GATK tools.
run.sbg:revisionNotes: [from Darko] You need to deselect (turn off) checkbox "Include in command line" for memory_per_job on INPUTS section on tool level.

sbg:revisionsInfo.sbg:revisionNotes: [from Darko] You need to deselect (turn off) checkbox "Include in command line" for memory_per_job on INPUTS section on tool level.
